definitions: bending or twisting of material out of its original flat or straight shape
process of arranging yarn lengthwise on a loom before weaving
examples: The wooden floorboards showed significant warping from moisture damage
Heat caused severe warping of the plastic dashboard components
The warping process took several hours to complete properly
Traditional warping requires careful attention to maintain even tension

definitions: legal document authorizing police to make an arrest or search
certificate entitling the holder to buy shares at a specified price
reasonable grounds or justification for an action, belief, or feeling
examples: The judge issued a search warrant for the suspect's residence
Police executed the arrest warrant early this morning
Stock warrants can provide leverage in investment portfolios
The company issued warrants along with the bond offering
The evidence doesn't warrant such a harsh conclusion
Her exceptional performance warrants a significant salary increase

definitions: written guarantee promising to repair or replace a faulty product
formal assurance in a contract regarding the condition of property
examples: The laptop comes with a three-year manufacturer's warranty
Extended warranty coverage protects against unexpected repair costs
The deed included warranties about the property's legal status
Breach of warranty can lead to significant legal consequences

definitions: network of interconnected underground tunnels where rabbits live
densely populated area with many narrow passages or small rooms
family name of English origin
examples: The rabbit warren extended beneath the entire hillside
Farmers often try to eliminate warrens to protect crops
The old apartment building was a warren of tiny units
Venice's streets form a confusing warren for tourists
Elizabeth Warren serves as a United States Senator
The Warren Commission investigated President Kennedy's assassination

definitions: person engaged in or experienced in warfare and combat
athlete who shows great determination and fighting spirit in competition
examples: Ancient warriors trained from childhood in combat techniques
The tribal warriors defended their territory with fierce determination
She's a true warrior on the basketball court
Despite multiple injuries, the warrior spirit kept him competing

definitions: ship equipped with weapons and designed for naval warfare
examples: The destroyer is a versatile warship for modern naval operations
Historic warships are preserved as floating museums in many ports

definitions: small hard benign growth on skin caused by viral infection
undesirable feature or characteristic that mars something otherwise good
examples: The dermatologist removed the wart using liquid nitrogen treatment
Common warts typically appear on hands and fingers
The software has a few warts but works well overall
Every city has its warts alongside its attractions

definitions: wild pig native to Africa with facial warts and curved tusks
examples: The warthog ran with its tail straight up like an antenna
Warthogs use burrows for shelter from predators and weather

definitions: period during which a war is being fought
examples: Wartime rationing affected every aspect of civilian life
Many wartime innovations later found peaceful applications

definitions: pungent green paste made from Japanese horseradish root
examples: A small amount of wasabi enhances the sushi's flavor
Real wasabi is expensive and often replaced with horseradish

definitions: act of cleaning something with water and usually soap
quantity of clothes or linens cleaned together in one cycle
thin layer of paint or color applied to a surface
examples: The car needs a thorough wash after the muddy road trip
Give your hands a proper wash before preparing food
She did three washes of laundry on Saturday morning
Separate the dark wash from the white clothes
The artist applied a light wash of blue watercolor
The wash gave the drawing a subtle background tone

definitions: ridged board formerly used for scrubbing clothes during washing
well-defined abdominal muscles visible as parallel ridges
examples: The antique washboard hung as decoration in the laundry room
Pioneer women spent hours scrubbing clothes on washboards
His intense workout routine gave him washboard abs
The fitness model's washboard stomach appeared in the advertisement

definitions: flat ring of metal or rubber used to seal joints or spread pressure
machine for automatically washing clothes and linens
person whose job involves washing things
examples: Replace the rubber washer to stop the faucet from dripping
The bolt needs a washer to distribute the load properly
The new washer has multiple cycle options for different fabrics
Front-loading washers typically use less water than top-loaders
The window washer worked on the skyscraper's fortieth floor
Dishwashers replaced many restaurant dish washers

definitions: clothes and linens that need to be or have been washed
action or process of cleaning something with water
examples: The washing piled up while they were on vacation
Hang the washing on the line to dry naturally
Frequent washing can damage delicate fabrics
The washing of vegetables removes pesticide residues

definitions: erosion of soil or roadway caused by flooding or heavy rain
person or thing that fails completely or is unsuccessful
event cancelled or ruined due to rain or bad weather
examples: The storm caused a major washout on the mountain road
Repair crews worked to fix the washout before rush hour
The new restaurant was a complete washout within six months
His career as an actor turned out to be a washout
The outdoor concert became a washout due to thunderstorms
Rain made the picnic a total washout

definitions: room with toilet and washing facilities, especially in public buildings
examples: The washroom is located at the end of the hallway
Please keep the washroom clean for the next person

definitions: flying insect with yellow and black stripes that can sting repeatedly
examples: The wasp built its paper nest under the roof eaves
Unlike bees, wasps can sting multiple times without dying

definitions: loss of material or resources through waste, decay, or leakage
reduction in workforce through resignation, retirement, or death
examples: Food wastage in restaurants amounts to thousands of pounds annually
The new packaging reduced product wastage during shipping
Natural wastage allowed the company to reduce staff without layoffs
Employee wastage increased after the merger announcement

definitions: material that is not wanted and typically thrown away or discarded
use of resources in a way that is not necessary or effective
large area of barren, uninhabited, or uncultivated land
examples: Industrial waste must be disposed of according to regulations
The city collects household waste twice per week
Leaving lights on in empty rooms is a waste of electricity
Don't waste your time on unproductive activities
The nuclear accident turned the area into a radioactive waste
Explorers crossed the frozen wastes of Antarctica

definitions: area of land that is barren, empty, or unable to support life
place lacking in cultural, spiritual, or aesthetic values
examples: The drought transformed fertile fields into a dusty wasteland
Post-apocalyptic fiction often features radioactive wastelands
Critics called suburban sprawl a cultural wasteland
The internet can be an intellectual wasteland without proper curation

definitions: water that has been used and contaminated by human activities
examples: The treatment plant processes millions of gallons of wastewater daily
Industrial wastewater requires special treatment before release

definitions: progressive deterioration or loss of body tissue, strength, or resources
examples: Muscle wasting occurs when patients are bedridden for extended periods
The wasting disease affected entire herds of deer

definitions: small timepiece worn on the wrist or carried in a pocket
period of keeping careful observation or being alert
period of duty as a guard or sentinel, especially on ships
examples: Her vintage watch was a family heirloom passed down generations
Smart watches can track fitness and receive notifications
Scientists kept watch for the rare bird's appearance
Neighborhood watch programs help reduce local crime
The sailor's watch lasted from midnight to four o'clock
Standing watch in rough seas required intense concentration

definitions: organization that monitors companies or governments for wrongdoing or inefficiency
dog kept to guard property and warn of intruders
examples: Consumer watchdog groups exposed the fraudulent business practices
The financial watchdog imposed heavy fines on the bank
Their German Shepherd served as an excellent watchdog
A good watchdog alerts owners without being overly aggressive

definitions: person who observes or monitors something carefully or regularly
examples: Bird watchers gathered at dawn to spot migrating species
Market watchers predict continued volatility in tech stocks

definitions: action of observing or monitoring something carefully over time
examples: Whale watching attracts thousands of tourists each season
The watching of security cameras revealed the theft

definitions: person who makes or repairs watches and clocks professionally
examples: The watchmaker carefully replaced the tiny broken spring
Swiss watchmakers are renowned for their precision and skill

definitions: person employed to keep guard and watch over property
examples: The night watchman patrolled the warehouse every two hours
Before modern security systems, watchmen protected most buildings

definitions: tall tower built for keeping watch over surrounding area
examples: Guards in the watchtower spotted approaching enemies miles away
Forest service watchtowers help spot wildfires early

definitions: clear liquid that forms seas, lakes, rivers, and rain
area of sea, lake, or river
sea area under the jurisdiction of a particular country
examples: Plants need water and sunlight to grow properly
Drinking eight glasses of water daily promotes good health
The boat glided across the calm waters of the lake
Dangerous waters surround the rocky coastline
Foreign vessels must respect our territorial waters
The incident occurred in international waters

definitions: controversial interrogation method involving simulated drowning by pouring water over covered face
examples: Human rights organizations condemn waterboarding as torture
The use of waterboarding sparked intense ethical debates

definitions: paint made with pigments suspended in water-based solution
painting created using watercolor paints
examples: Artists appreciate watercolor for its translucent, luminous qualities
Children often start with watercolor because it's easy to clean
The gallery displayed her delicate watercolor landscapes
This watercolor captures the morning light beautifully

definitions: paint made with pigments suspended in water-based solution
painting created using watercolour paints
examples: British artists traditionally excel at watercolour techniques
The watercolour medium allows for subtle gradations
The museum acquired several Victorian watercolours
Her watercolour of the cathedral won first prize

definitions: natural or artificial channel through which water flows
examples: The ancient watercourse still supplies the village with fresh water
Environmental laws protect natural watercourses from pollution

definitions: any vehicle or vessel designed for traveling on or through water
examples: Personal watercraft must be registered with the state
The marina accommodates various types of recreational watercraft

definitions: place where water flows over a vertical drop in a river
examples: Niagara Falls is one of the world's most famous waterfalls
The hikers heard the waterfall before they saw it

definitions: birds that live on or near water, especially ducks, geese, and swans
examples: Hunters must follow strict regulations during waterfowl season
The wetlands provide critical habitat for migrating waterfowl

definitions: part of a city or town alongside a body of water
examples: The waterfront district features restaurants and shops
Property values along the waterfront continue to rise

definitions: act of supplying water to plants or animals
examples: Daily watering keeps the garden vegetables healthy
Automatic watering systems save time and conserve water

definitions: line on a ship's hull showing the water level when properly loaded
line of eye makeup applied along the edge of the eyelid
examples: Barnacles had attached themselves below the ship's waterline
The waterline marking helps prevent dangerous overloading
She applied dark eyeliner to her lower waterline
Waterline makeup can make eyes appear larger

definitions: final, decisive defeat that ends someone's success or ambitions
examples: The scandal proved to be the politician's waterloo
Every champion eventually meets their waterloo

definitions: faint design visible in paper when held against light
translucent image or text overlaid on digital content for identification
examples: The authentic currency showed a clear watermark
Hold the document up to see the watermark
The photographer added a watermark to protect her images
Remove the watermark by purchasing the full version

definitions: large round fruit with hard green skin and sweet red flesh
examples: Seedless watermelons have become more popular than seeded varieties
Nothing beats cold watermelon on a hot summer day

definitions: garment made from material that prevents water from passing through
examples: Don't forget your waterproof if rain is forecast
The hiker's waterproof kept her dry during the storm

definitions: process or material used to make something resistant to water penetration
examples: Basement waterproofing prevents costly water damage
The waterproofing on these boots lasts for years

definitions: area of land that drains water into a specific river or lake
critical turning point that marks a division or change
examples: The Mississippi River watershed covers much of central North America
Protecting watersheds ensures clean drinking water supplies
The court decision marked a watershed in civil rights history
The invention of the internet was a watershed moment

definitions: area of land immediately adjacent to a body of water
examples: The waterside restaurant offers stunning sunset views
Children played along the waterside collecting shells

definitions: river, canal, or other body of water used as a route for travel
examples: Commercial barges use the inland waterways for shipping
The ancient waterway connected two major trading cities

definitions: large wheel turned by flowing water to generate power or lift water
examples: The old mill's waterwheel still turns after two centuries
Waterwheels provided power before steam engines were invented

definitions: unit of power equal to one joule per second
examples: This light bulb uses only ten watts of electricity
The microwave operates at eight hundred watts
